## Installation Links

```{r, echo=FALSE}
urls <- c("https://cran.r-project.org/bin/windows/base/",
          "https://www.rstudio.com/products/rstudio/download/#download",
          "https://git-scm.com/downloads")
link.df <- data.frame(
  Software = c("R", "R Studio", "Git"),
  Link = paste0("[", urls, "](", urls, ")")
)

knitr::kable(link.df)
```

## Updating Software and Packages

### R

Run the following code in the R GUI (code copied from: https://www.r-statistics.com/2013/03/updating-r-from-r-on-windows-using-the-installr-package/). Make sure R Studio is closed.

```{r, eval=FALSE}
# installing/loading the package:
if(!require(installr)) {
install.packages("installr");
require(installr)
} #load / install+load installr

# using the package:
updateR()
```

### RStudio

In RStudio -> Help -> Check for Updates -> follow instructions

### R-Packages

In RStudio -> Tools -> Check for Package Updatesâ€¦ - > follow instructions
